summary: This is an email chain from October 2020 between FBI personnel and a U.S. Attorney's Office paralegal regarding technical difficulties loading images from a drive (NYC024383) for review. The emails discuss troubleshooting the issue to ensure no responsive items are missed in the case.

persons.name: B. (NY) (FBI)
persons.context: Appears as the sender of the forwarded email chain, coordinating access to a case on a machine for someone to view images from drive NYC024383.

persons.name: M, I. (NY) (FBI)
persons.role: NY CART Coordinator, Senior Forensic Examiner
persons.context: Discusses the technical issue with loading images from drive NYC024383, speculates it might be a partial image recovery, and arranges for someone to load the case.

persons.name: Heys (NY)(FBI)
persons.context: Requests access to a device to view images from drive NYC024383 on their end, asking if they can view it the next morning.

persons.name: (USANYS) [Contractor]
persons.role: Paralegal Specialist, U.S. Attorney's Office SDNY
persons.context: Reports a problem loading images from drive NYC024383, describing images that load briefly before being covered by a solid block of color, and requests the FBI review the photos to ensure no responsive items are missed.

persons.name: MI (USANYS)
persons.context: Listed as a recipient (Cc) in the email from the paralegal specialist regarding the image loading issue.

connections.description: Both are FBI personnel involved in coordinating technical forensic examination of evidence (drive NYC024383).
The paralegal specialist from the U.S. Attorney's Office is communicating with the FBI's CART Coordinator about technical issues with evidence (drive NYC024383) for case review.
Both are associated with the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY), with the paralegal copying MI on the email about the evidence issue.

events.title: Report of Image Loading Issue on Drive NYC024383
events.description: A paralegal specialist from the U.S. Attorney's Office reports to the FBI that many images on drive NYC024383 either do not load or load briefly before being obscured by a solid block of color, requesting FBI review.

events.title: FBI Coordination to Access Drive NYC024383
events.description: FBI personnel forward and discuss the email chain, arranging for someone to load the case on a machine to examine the problematic images from drive NYC024383.

keyFacts: The document is an email chain concerning technical difficulties with loading images from a specific drive labeled NYC024383, which is part of an ongoing investigation.
The issue involves images that load for a fraction of a second before being covered by a solid block of color, potentially obscuring responsive evidence.

The communication is between the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) and the FBI's Computer Analysis and Response Team (CART), indicating collaborative evidence review.
The document is marked as 'SUBJECT TO PROTECTIVE ORDER' referencing specific paragraphs, indicating it contains sensitive or confidential case information.
The emails show active troubleshooting efforts in October 2020 to ensure no evidence is missed during the review of digital media.
